intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium mukaczevense, commonly known as the Mukaczeven hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
